class.name: Word.TableColumnCollection
class.description: Represents a collection of [Word.TableColumn](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.tablecolumn) objects in a Word document.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a TableColumnCollection to verify the connection between the add-in and Word before performing table operations.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.

examples.description: Get all columns from the first table and highlight the cells in every other column with yellow background.

methods.name: add
methods.description: Returns a TableColumn object that represents a column added to a table.

params.name: beforeColumn
params.description: Optional. The column before which the new column is added.

examples.description: Add a new column before the second column in the first table of the document

methods.name: autoFit
methods.description: Changes the width of a table column to accommodate the width of the text without changing the way text wraps in the cells.

examples.description: Auto-fit all columns in the first table to accommodate their text content without changing text wrapping
Delete all columns from the first table in the document

methods.name: distributeWidth
methods.description: Adjusts the width of the specified columns so that they are equal.

examples.description: Distribute the width equally across all columns in the first table of the document

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: `propertyNamesAndPaths.select` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and `propertyNamesAndPaths.expand` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the width of each column in the first table of the document
Select all columns in the first table of the document to highlight them for the user

methods.name: setWidth
methods.description: Sets the width of columns in a table.

examples.description: Set all columns in the first table to 100 points width using auto fit ruler style

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.TableColumnCollection object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.TableColumnCollectionData) that contains an "items" array with shallow copies of any loaded properties from the collection's items.

examples.description: Export table column information to JSON format for logging or external processing

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track table columns across multiple sync calls to maintain object references when modifying column properties outside of a single batch operation

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Load table columns, get their count, then untrack the collection to free memory after use
